#summary Create a moderated chat room instance

==Description==
  * *Authorization Level:* require_user


==Parameters==
<table cellpadding="2" style="background-color:#E0FFFF; border:1px solid #48D1CC; margin: 0px; width: 100%">
|| *Required* || *Name* || *Type* || *Description* ||
|| required || call_def_id || integer || Should be 1 for a moderated chat room and 3 for a broadcast chat room ||
|| || call_name || string || Name of the video chat room ||
|| || call_type || string  || "open" to allow anyone to join the call or "closed" to force participants to ask to join the call ||
|| || call_owner || integer || User ID of the owner of the call who can always enter and leave regardless of the type of the call ||
</table>

==Error Codes==


==Return Syntax==
{{{ 
<CallInstance uri="call.6319" call_instance_id="6319">
  <attributes>
	<fms_instance></fms_instance>
	<name>Melih O.'s Chat</name>
	<end_date></end_date>
  </attributes>
  <ParticipantMap>
	<Participant>
	  <rank>1</rank>
	  <user_uri_pattern>user.547747</user_uri_pattern>
	  <participant_type>Owner</participant_type>
	</Participant>
	<Participant>
	  <rank>99999</rank>
	  <user_uri_pattern>user</user_uri_pattern>
	  <participant_type>Blocked</participant_type>
	</Participant>
  </ParticipantMap>
  <ACL>
	<ACLItem>&lt;AclInstance call.participant_type.Participant can access call.state.join&gt;</ACLItem>
	<ACLItem>&lt;AclInstance call.participant_type.Owner can access call&gt;</ACLItem>
	<ACLItem>&lt;AclInstance call.participant_type.Moderator can access call&gt;</ACLItem>
  </ACL>
  <Resources>
	
			<Resource id="3552">
	  			<type>whitelist</type>
	  			
	  
	  				<Userlist value="3552" type="whitelist">
   						<User>user.547935</User>
	 	 			</Userlist>
			</Resource>
  </Resources>
</CallInstance>
}}}

==Notes==
  * The {callerName} is used to notify users who are invited as to who is inviting them.
  * After creating a call, use [CreateInvite Create Invite] to invite any party you wish to join the call.
